admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
The project would support the
            Government's objective of rationalizing and developing
            the mining industry by providing consultancy services for
            the following project components:  (a) Phosphate - The
            efficiency and profitability of CPG's existing
            operations would be improved, and feasibility studies on
            four open pit deposits prepared; (b) Potash - This component
            would lay the ground for the establishment of a potentially
            important new export industry.  A first phase would develop
            technical and economic information on three potash deposits
            in Southern Tunisia to identify the optimal configuration of
            a potash project.  In a second phase, the feasibility of the
            option selected in Phase I would be studied in detail and
            investment proposals prepared; and (c) Mining policy - This
            component would analyze and define the role of ONM in
            mineral exploration and development, and define
            organizational, staffing and budgetary requirements to help
            ONM meet its objectives.  The component would enhance the
            ability of the Government and ONM to plan and implement a
            rational mining exploration policy.
